description: This course will introduce knowledge of the fundamentals with Windows operating system concepts in a Windows environment. 00:07:18.870 --> 00:07:21.400

00:07:21.400 --> 00:07:24.710

00:07:53.574 --> 00:07:58.931

59
00:02:39.051 --> 00:02:42.255
I always remember for

it's technically a Windows installer

.exe is also an application, and

00:02:56.260 --> 00:02:58.440

67

68
00:03:06.260 --> 00:03:09.290

69
00:03:09.290 --> 00:03:11.728

00:03:11.728 --> 00:03:15.164

00:03:18.018 --> 00:03:21.880
Well, it keeps track of where it
makes entries into the registry and

73
00:03:21.880 --> 00:03:23.790
it modifies the registry.

74
00:03:23.790 --> 00:03:24.520
And that's important,

75
00:03:24.520 --> 00:03:27.650
because what can happen when
you use just basic executables?

76
00:03:27.650 --> 00:03:30.490
Sometimes basic executables,
they don't keep track of all that.

77
00:03:30.490 --> 00:03:33.750
So what ends up happening is that when
you go to remove the application,

78
00:03:33.750 --> 00:03:38.000
if it's an MSI file, it can look at the
INF file or the INI file, depending on how

79
00:03:38.000 --> 00:03:41.790

made these modifications to the registry.

80
00:03:41.790 --> 00:03:45.100
I need to undo those, right, and

81
00:03:45.100 --> 00:03:48.650
And that's good, because executables

00:03:48.650 --> 00:03:51.299
They'll leave their remnants
down in the registry, and

83
00:03:51.299 --> 00:03:54.389
you can start basically clustering

00:03:54.389 --> 00:03:58.051
what ends up happening is you get what

85
00:03:58.051 --> 00:04:01.178
And all that means is not literally that

00:04:01.178 --> 00:04:01.732

87
00:04:01.732 --> 00:04:05.428
What it means is that you're leaving
remnants behind in the operating system at

88
00:04:05.428 --> 00:04:06.318
the lowest level.

89
00:04:06.318 --> 00:04:09.140
And what happens is it can over time,
it can corrupt,

90
00:04:09.140 --> 00:04:12.860
it can eventually lead to performance

91
00:04:12.860 --> 00:04:16.698

00:04:16.698 --> 00:04:18.730

00:04:18.730 --> 00:04:20.910

00:04:20.910 --> 00:04:26.370

00:04:26.370 --> 00:04:30.490

00:04:30.490 --> 00:04:34.080

97
00:04:34.080 --> 00:04:37.470
Executables, you can't do that,
it's not the same way.

98
00:04:37.470 --> 00:04:42.198
So if you wanna do deployment to a single
application on multiple computers across

99
00:04:42.198 --> 00:04:44.950
your network,
then MSI files are the way to go.

100
00:04:44.950 --> 00:04:48.840
Now, that being said, one of the things
that we wanna do is we wanna go ahead and

101
00:04:48.840 --> 00:04:50.370

102
00:04:50.370 --> 00:04:54.710
Now you're gonna see that it's gonna come
up with just whatever the end-user license

00:04:54.710 --> 00:04:56.190
agreement might be.

Again, I just happened to be

This goes for

00:05:09.094 --> 00:05:10.586
That's where the driver comes in.

107
00:05:10.586 --> 00:05:13.538

108
00:05:13.538 --> 00:05:19.550

109
00:05:19.550 --> 00:05:23.140
And the high level programming language

00:05:23.140 --> 00:05:26.280

00:05:36.230 --> 00:05:39.670

116
00:05:39.670 --> 00:05:45.160

117
00:05:45.160 --> 00:05:46.160
Your device drivers.

00:05:46.160 --> 00:05:49.600

>> [LAUGH]
>> [LAUGH] And

00:07:36.190 --> 00:07:39.040
We had to do all this manually, right?

00:07:39.040 --> 00:07:41.190

Plug and play, it will look at the device,
